intro: Anemonastrum yulongshanicum, commonly known as the Yulongshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in high-altitude ecosystems.
